008 800507s1497                        frm  
  
100 10 $a Brant, Sebastian
  
245 10 $a Das Narrenschiff [French] La nef des folz du monde. Translated from the Latin version of Locher by Pierre Rivière
  
260 00 $a Paris $b [Félix Baligault?], for Geoffroy de Marnef, Johann Philippi de Cruzenach and Magnus Steyner $c [not before Dec.] 1497
  
260 00 $b [Jean Lambert]
  
260 00 $c [between 8 Mar. and 15 Apr. 1498]
  
300 00 $c f~~
  
500 00 $a Woodcuts. GW assigned the printing to Lambert. "Man stener" of the colophon, taken as a surname of Philippi by GW, is identified as a German at the Sorbonne by BMC VIII pp.xxxiii n.1, xxxvi n.2. According to CIBN this edition should be dated following the old system i.e. before Easter 1498. The date 8 March is derived from the Latin edition of 8 March 1498, close in time, but where the device is clearly in better state

008 800611s1500                        lat  
  
245 10 $a Informatio perutilis de fraternitate et rosario gloriosae virginis Mariae
  
260 00 $a [Augsburg $b n.pr. $c about 1500]
  
260 00 $a [The Netherlands?]
  
300 00 $c 4~~
  
500 00 $a Doubtfully ascribed by Campbell to the Netherlands, but excluded by HPT on the basis of types. GW MS described the Kempten copy with the beginning f.la: "Informatio putilis de fraternitate / / et Rosario gloriose virginis Marie.  / / Notum sit cristifidelibi vniuersis: q sancta...", end f.2b, l.8: "Inclita pura pia castissima virgo Maria / / Esto salutata semper prole beata / / Me tibi virgo pia comendo semper Maria" and assigned it to Kunne (type 6). But it is not clear, whether the Kempten copy and that one cited by Goff belong to the same edition

001 ij00553300
  
008 070122s1498                        lat  
  
100 10 $a Justinianus
  
245 10 $a Digestum vetus (with the Glossa ordinaria of Accursius and Summaria of Hieronymus Clarius)
  
260 00 $a [Milan? $b n.pr.] $c 31 Oct. 1498
  
260 00 $a Venice? $b Baptista de Tortis?
  
300 00 $c f~~
  
500 00 $a 356 ff., 2-354 so numbered. 2 col, 77 ll. Fol.1a Title: "Digestum vetus / de Tortis", Fol.1b "Bernardino Crasso Clarissimo iurisconsulto veneto Hieronymus clarius Brix.iuris.v. doctor Prothonota= / rius z comes apostolicus Salutem. / .. " Fol.2a with sign. ajj: "C In noie dni Jesu christi Impera / tor a Justinianus b : cesar c ..." Ends. Fol.352 "Impressum venetijs per / Baptistam de tortis / M.cccc.lxxxxviij. / die vltio octo- / bris // Finis". The correctness of the colophon is doubtful: types, device etc. differ from de Tortis' editions. BMC (reprint 1963) V 330 (IC.21494, ms note) suggests it might be a Milanese reprint
  
510 00 $a G.A. Schneider, A descriptive catalogue of the incunabula in the library of Gonville & Caius College Cambridge (Cambridge, 1928), 38

001 il00326000
  
008 800611s1500                        lat  
  
100 10 $a Lucianus Samosatensis
  
245 10 $a Dialogus de funerali pompa [Latin] (Tr: Rinucius Aretinus). Add: De praecedentia Alexandri, Hannibalis et Scipionis [Latin] (Tr: Johannes Arispa (i.e. Aurispa))
  
260 00 $a Leipzig $b Jacobus Thanner $c 1500
  
300 00 $c 4~~
  
500 00 $a Transcription and collation in IBP
  
500 00 $a De funerali pompa (Dial. mortuorum 10), with Rinucius' preface, is printed here under the title Dialogus quomodo solus nudus per Acheronta transvehi potest, and the translation assigned to 'Arispa' (so catalogued by Goff and others). The De praecedentia ... (Dial. mortuorum 12) really translated by Aurispa is also found under the title De praestantia (De presidentia) trium principum

001 il00330000
  
008 800611s1497                        lat  
  
100 10 $a Lucianus Samosatensis
  
245 10 $a Vera historia [Latin]. Tr: Lilius (Tifernas) Castellanus. Add: De asino aureo; Philosophorum vitae; Scipio; Tyrannus; Scaphidium (Dialogus de funerali pompa); Palinurus; Charon; Diogenes; Terpsion; Hercules; Virtus dea; In amorem; Timon; Sermo de calumnia; Laus muscae
  
260 00 $a Milan $b Uldericus Scinzenzeler $c 22 Mar. 1497
  
300 00 $c 4~~
  
500 00 $a The translations after the Vera Historia are by various hands. The Palinurus attributed to Lucianus is in fact the De felicitate et miseria of Maphaeus Vegius. The Carmina heroica in amorem are a free translation of the second idyll of Moschus (BMC VIII 412). Virtus Dea, purporting to be a translation from Lucianus by Carolus Marsupinus, is an original Latin work of Leo Baptista Alberti

500 00 $a On the identity of the printer (designated by GW the Printer of the 'Fardelet du temps'), see H. Delarue in Genava 3 (1925) pp.297-307; on the chronology of the Genevan editions of Macer Floridus, see Delarue in Genava 2 (1924) pp.177-86. Lőkkös dates about 1496, CIBN not after 1498, Goff about 1500. Proctor assigned to Paris. FairMur(F) records a variant with the misprint 'cognoscere' in the penultimate line of the last page, also found in both BL copies with an additional misprint 'vire' in the first line of the poem on a2. Hillard supposes that H 10418 refers to a composite edition (HC 10418 is the Mazarine copy). Woodcuts

001 im00644000
  
008 800616s1488                        lat  
  
245 10 $a Missale Aboense (Turku, Âbo)
  
260 00 $a Lübeck $b Bartholomaeus Ghotan $c [after] 17 Aug. 1488
  
300 00 $c f~~
  
500 00 $a The preface is dated 17 Aug. 1488. Ghotan's Missale Dominicanum (Weale-Boh 1820) issued at the same time largely shares the same typesetting (E. Häkli, in Librarium 31 (1988) pp. 156-68). Many of the single leaves recorded were issued with copies of G.E. Klemming, Sveriges äldre liturgiska literatur, Stockholm, 1879, and may in fact come from copies of the Missale Dominicanum. Woodcut
  
510 00 $a Goff M644
  
510 00 $a HC 11253
  
510 00 $a GfT 396, 781, 784, 785
  
510 00 $a Weale p. 17
  
510 00 $a Weale-Boh 1

001 ir00190600
  
008 820128s1498                        ita  
  
245 10 $a Nuovo ricettario composto dal Collegio dei Dottori di Firenze. Ed: Hieronymus dal Pozzo Toscanelli
  
260 00 $a Florence $b Societas Colubris (Compagnia del Drago) $c 10 Jan. 1498, '21 Jan. 1498'
  
300 00 $c f~~
  
500 00 $a Woodcuts
  
500 00 $a The variant of H 13910 described in BMC differs only in having the last leaf of text (and its conjugate, l2) in a different setting, with colophon dated 10 Jan. 1498 and the words following the date: 'Emendato & correcto per maestro Hieronymo di maestro Lodouico medico & ciptadino fiorantino dal pozzo toschanelli'. There is otherwise no significant textual difference. The style of setting in the BL copy is closer to that of the rest of the book and suggests that H 13910 dated 21 Jan. 1498 is the later issue, suppressing the name of Lodovico Toscanelli

500 00 $a 65 ll. Type: 6:91G. Text begins. "Von gotes gnaden Wolfganng Phalntzgraue bey // Rein Hertzog in Obernn vnd Nidernn Bayren zc // Vnsern grusz zuuor Wirdiger in Got Andechtiger lieber getrüwer. Wir seyn vngezweiuelt. Ir seyt durch vnser auszgegangen gschrift/ an Ew beschehe..." l.64 "...Montag Nach Purificationis Ma // rie/ Anno domini Tausent Vierhundert vnnd In dem Ain vnd Newntzigisten Jaren"
